[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/encryption_dlog.rs] [Integration with consensus] [Byzantine validators] Can <1/3 Byzantine validators collude to choose malicious encryption keys that allow them to decrypt honest validators' shares and reconstruct the dealt secret? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/encryption_dlog.rs] [Integration with consensus] [Key verification] Is there proof-of-knowledge verification that validators actually know the decryption key corresponding to their registered encryption key, or can they register keys for which they don't know the discrete log? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/encryption_dlog.rs] [Derive: Clone for PublicParameters/EncryptPubKey] [Deep copy] Does cloning properly deep-copy internal group elements, or can shallow copies allow attackers to mutate shared references and corrupt multiple key instances? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/encryption_dlog.rs] [Feature gate: assert-private-keys-not-cloneable] [Build configuration] Can attackers compile without this feature flag to enable DecryptPrivKey cloning, allowing key duplication attacks in production? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/encryption_dlog.rs] [Struct fields visibility] [Encapsulation] Can external code access pub(crate) fields ek and dk through module-level access, bypassing validation and allowing direct mutation of key material? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/encryption_dlog.rs] [Type safety] [Newtype bypass] Can attackers use type transmutation or unsafe code to convert between DecryptPrivKey and raw Scalar, bypassing zeroization and validation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/encryption_dlog.rs] [Memory layout] [Structure padding] Can attackers exploit uninitialized padding bytes in struct layout to leak key material or cause non-deterministic serialization? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/encryption_dlog.rs] [Scalar operations] [Modular reduction] When scalars are deserialized from bytes, is modular reduction applied correctly to ensure values are within the field order, preventing wraparound attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/encryption_dlog.rs] [Scalar operations] [Inverse existence] Does the code verify that scalars used in inversion operations (dk^{-1}) are non-zero before computing inverses, or can zero scalars cause undefined behavior? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/encryption_dlog.rs] [Group operations] [Point doubling] Can attackers exploit edge cases in point addition (e.g., P + P vs P + Q) to cause different execution paths that leak timing information about private keys? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/encryption_dlog.rs] [Group operations] [Scalar multiplication] Is scalar multiplication implemented with constant-time algorithms, or can attackers use timing attacks during h^{dk^{-1}} computation to recover bits of dk? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/encryption_dlog.rs] [Function: from_bytes_be()] [Unwrap panic] Does unwrap() on Scalar::from_bytes_be() allow attackers to panic validator nodes by providing invalid byte sequences, causing liveness failures? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/encryption_dlog.rs] [Trait: TryFrom implementations] [Error propagation] Are all deserialization errors properly caught and converted to Result types, or can some error paths panic and crash validator nodes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/encryption_dlog.rs] [Function: to_compressed()] [Compression failure] If point compression fails for certain group elements, does the code handle the failure gracefully or panic, allowing DoS attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/encryption_dlog.rs] [Function: to_bytes()] [Array bounds] Can fixed-size array returns cause panics if the underlying implementation produces different-sized output than expected? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/encryption_dlog.rs] [Function: to_bytes()/to_bytes_be()] [Timing variation] Can attackers measure timing differences in serialization to infer whether private keys have leading zeros or other structural properties? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/encryption_dlog.rs] [Trait: PartialEq for EncryptPubKey] [Non-constant time] Does byte-by-byte comparison in equality check leak information about where two public keys first differ through early termination? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/encryption_dlog.rs] [Function: generate()] [RNG timing] Can attackers measure time to generate random scalars to infer PRNG state or detect weak randomness sources? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/encryption_dlog.rs] [Function: try_from()] [Validation timing] Can timing differences between successful deserialization and various error paths leak information about the structure of secret keys? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/encryption_dlog.rs] [Struct: DecryptPrivKey] [Cache timing] Can attackers use cache timing attacks on validators to extract decryption key bits during share decryption operations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/encryption_dlog.rs] [Module: g1] [Missing public parameters] Why are public parameters commented out for g1 module, and can this cause protocol vulnerabilities where g1 keys are used without proper parameter validation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/encryption_dlog.rs] [Module: g2] [Parameter mismatch] Can attackers exploit differences between g1 and g2 module capabilities (g2 has PublicParameters, g1 doesn't) to cause protocol inconsistencies? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/encryption_dlog.rs] [Macro instantiation] [Type parameter injection] Can attackers exploit differences in how macros are instantiated for g1 vs g2 to cause type confusion between G1Projective and G2Projective? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/encryption_dlog.rs] [External usage] [Key lifecycle] Is there proper key rotation enforced at higher protocol layers, or can validators reuse encryption/decryption keys indefinitely, increasing exposure to cryptanalysis? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/encryption_dlog.rs] [External usage] [Proof verification] Do PVSS transcript verification functions properly check that encrypted shares were created with the registered encryption keys, or can attackers substitute shares? (Critical)
